body:
### Describe the bug

When defining an f-string with an immediate `\`, this translates to `\\\n...` instead of `...`.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

1. Cython: : `StringBug_cy.pyx`
```cython
def test1():
  s1 = """\
foo
bar
"""

  s2 = """foo
bar
"""

  if s1 != s2:
    print("  strings are not equal")
  else:
    print("  strings are equal")


def test2():
  s1 = f"""\
foo
bar
"""

  s2 = f"""foo
bar
"""

  if s1 != s2:
    print("f-strings are not equal")
  else:
    print("f-strings are equal")
```

```posh
C:\Temp\Cython> cythonize.exe -i -3 -j 4 "*.pyx"
Compiling C:\Temp\Cython\StringBug_cy.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Cythonizing C:\Temp\Cython\StringBug_cy.pyx
StringBug_cy.c
   Bibliothek "C:\Temp\Cython\tmp2igqncp5\Release\Temp\Cython\StringBug_cy.cp312-win_amd64.lib" und Objekt "C:\Temp\Cython\tmp2igqncp5\Release\Temp\Cython\StringBug_cy.cp312-win_amd64.exp" werden erstellt.
Code wird generiert.
Codegenerierung ist abgeschlossen.


C:\Temp\Cython> py -3.12 -c "from StringBug_cy import *; test1(); test2()"
  strings are equal
f-strings are not equal
```

2. CPython: `StringBug_py.py`
```python
def test1():
  s1 = """\
foo
bar
"""

  s2 = """foo
bar
"""

  if s1 != s2:
    print("  strings are not equal")
  else:
    print("  strings are equal")


def test2():
  s1 = f"""\
foo
bar
"""

  s2 = f"""foo
bar
"""

  if s1 != s2:
    print("f-strings are not equal")
  else:
    print("f-strings are equal")
```

```posh
C:\Temp\Cython> py -3.12 -c "from StringBug_py import *; test1(); test2()"
  strings are equal
f-strings are equal
```

### Expected behaviour

normal multi-line strings and multi-line f-strings need to have the same behavior when it comes to the backslash character.

### OS

Windows 11

### Python version

3.12.2

### Cython version

3.0.9

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
I think it'll just be in https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/b197288e92f58278bd614d0e88b6a4330eb1bbe2/Cython/Compiler/Parsing.py#L1143-L1163

but I'm struggling to see that regex as anything other than a random collection of slashes and brackets at the moment.

title: [BUG] Multi-line f-string literals do not adhere to """\ syntax
